meanings.definition: A tedious passage in a work of literature or music.
meanings.sent1: The novel had a longueur that made it hard to stay interested.
meanings.sent2: The opera had a few longueurs that seemed to drag on forever.
meanings.sent3: During the longueur in the play, some audience members started to doze off.
meanings.sent4: The longueur in the symphony felt like a never-ending journey through boredom.
meanings.sent5: The longueur in the movie was like a slow walk through a field of yawns.

meanings.definition: A dull or boring section of a performance.
meanings.sent1: The play had a longueur that made the audience restless.
meanings.sent2: The concert had a few longueurs where people started checking their phones.
meanings.sent3: The longueur in the comedy show made even the comedian yawn.
meanings.sent4: The longueur in the dance performance felt like a stumble through tedium.
meanings.sent5: The longueur in the magic show was like watching paint dry on a wall.

meanings.definition: A long and tedious speech or conversation.
meanings.sent1: The politician's longueur seemed to go on without end.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lecture had a longueur that made students lose focus.
meanings.sent3: During the longueur of the meeting, some attendees started doodling on their notepads.
meanings.sent4: The longueur of the debate felt like a battle of who could talk the longest.
meanings.sent5: The longueur of the conversation was like listening to a broken record repeating the same tune.
